Sentencas: Nowadays, by no means fortuitous, pollution-free and bio-regenerative solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have arisen to be a competitive candidate as next generation renewable energy, which exhibiting high energy efficiency and flexible fuel choices.
Titulo: Probing oxide-ion conduction in low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: However, fast oxide-ion transportation of electrolyte could only be ensured in high working temperature by conventional views, which can decrease the voltage loss and further determine the electrical performance of SOFCs.
Titulo: Probing oxide-ion conduction in low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: Herein we report an in-situ and non-contact method to monitor the working condition of SOFCs and it is potential to become a promising optical temperature sensor to detect the working temperature of electrolyte materials.
Titulo: Probing oxide-ion conduction in low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: With the combinative protocol between density functional theory calculation and up-conversion (UC) luminescence, the entanglement between thermal-driven formed O-ion Frenkel pair (native solubilizer) and Bi3+ dopant (competitive inhibitor) in La2Mo2O9 derivatives has been unraveled, especially at a lower temperature required by a future SOFCs device.
Titulo: Probing oxide-ion conduction in low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: It is a potential route for screening and characterizing the candidate electrolyte onsets in lower temperature without sacrificing electrical performance.
Titulo: Probing oxide-ion conduction in low-temperature SOFCs
